abstract: Memo from Washington; Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani addresses dinner in his honor at State Dept, revealing little-known ties between him and much of American national security establishment; Ghani, Columbia graduate and resident of Washington for 15 years, has been urging renewed American commitment to Afghanistan, goal achieved as Pres Obama forestalls plan to reduce American military presence there in 2015.
lead_paragraph: President Ashraf Ghani of Afghanistan, addressing a joint meeting of Congress, said he wanted to repair a partnership that had frayed badly.

headline.main: Ghani Addresses Congress, Eager to Rebuild Afghan-U.S. Ties
headline.print_headline: Choreographing a Renewal of Afghan Ties

snippet: President Ashraf Ghani of Afghanistan, addressing a joint meeting of Congress, said he wanted to repair a partnership that had frayed badly.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
